intro: Sida bicuspidata, commonly known as the two-lobed sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with serrated edges and small, pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in sandy or loamy soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Sida bicuspidata is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands.
